reviews.title: good location
reviews.text: simple but clean just like we want. free parking and not too far from fisherman wharf and center.

reviews.title: Great Deal
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I booked a room here the night before we came up for a weekend, and I was very happy with the motel. We usually stay in nicer places, but the room was a good deal, so we went for it. It was very clean, and the bed was quite comfortable. It is also in a great spot where it only takes a few minutes to walk to downtown and the wharf. I don't go on vacation to hang out in the room, but this place pleasantly surprised the both of us.

reviews.title: Good price, but you get what you pay for
reviews.text: We got this Travelodge for a snip (something like $55 in June). It was ok for resting your head for a night but that's about it. To be fair it is fairly well-placed for the Wharf compared to the other budget hotels but some of the other ones further up Munras Av. are prettier. It also sits right next to a petrol station. The rooms would have been ok if it were not for the very dirty carpets. We had 2 rooms and both carpets left my infant son with dirty soles of his feet (as was mentioned in another review - certainly not a one-off). If they fixed this things might be ok. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I guess the place could do with a makeover. Parking area under the hotel is good. The Diner across the road is very good. If you are price conscious and take a pair of slippers - or perhaps never take your socks off - then this is the place for you. But be warned you do get what you pay for. This said it didn't really detract from our stay. However, if going back to Monterey I would pay a bit more and get somehwere with a cleaner carpet.

reviews.title: Cheap and it shows!
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel as we had decided to drive from San Francisco to Los Angeles, and stayed here for one night en route. Thank god it was only one night!

reviews.title: Great Location, Good Price
reviews.text: The decoration was gaudy, and the bed covers were awful. Fair enough though - cheap and cheerful.

reviews.title: Never Again!
reviews.text: I laid down on the bed, propping my head against the headboard. After chatting with my girlfriend for a few minutes, I went to sit up only to find that my hair had become "glued" to the sticky bedhead. Eugh.

reviews.title: Great location, Good value, nice people
reviews.text: On "investigating" the bathroom, I found something that looked like a serial killer's hideout - it was tight and grim, and when I went to the loo later in the evening, I saw a woodlouse doing his thing in there. Not a good scene. Didn't tell my girlfriend that one until we were sat here writing this review. Now she's freaking out about it. Doh!

reviews.title: Really good budget motel. Recommended.
reviews.text: Also, the free coffee was the worst I tasted whilst in the US. My god, it was just awful. In fact, the whole scene was horrible - even the incredibly slow "teak" elevator.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Travelodge Friday and Sat night. we were greeted by a great manager and he was very helpful in telling us all of the dos and don'ts of monterey. We had no expectations, I spent most of my time planning the Napa portion of our trip. Our room had recently been redone and we were excited to find great new beds, frig, tv that worked and a big fan along with the new ac unit. I love fans just for white noise but it was really not noisy here. We parked in the underground parking and never moved our car till we left Sunday morning. We took the bus that is close by to Carmel, great move because parking is impossible there. This hotel was clean, close to everything, in a safe area and the coffee, pastry and fruit in the morning were just an added bonus. This was a great deal for the money, loved not having to drive, 10 min walk to fishermen's wharf, five min to Mucky ducks, thanks for the tip!!! The walk to Cannery row was less than 25 but kept stopping to look at the sea lions. We will be back!
reviews.title: Monterey travelodge

reviews.text: 2 night stay whilst we took in a whale-watching trip.
reviews.title: the handiest of the cheaper hotels for beautiful Monterey

likes.liked: — Walking distance of all major attractions

reviews.text: Great location for the waterfront and downtown restaurants and shops. Only trouble is, the noise from the nearby [busy] intersection.
reviews.title: the rip off

likes.liked: — keep calling to make sure you have a room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Helpful advice from front desk on most things - laundromat, restaurants.
reviews.title: Good location but ok hotel
good value, service is a hassle
reviews.text: Don't expect much in terms of complimentary breakfast though!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were travelling by public transport and this was incredibly convenient, not only when we arrived from Salinas but throughout our stay. Everything was within easy walking distance. The place was comfortable, clean, provided a good breakfast, free internet access and had very helpful staff. There was even a pool. ( Do not confuse it with the other Travelodge which is further out of town)
reviews.title: Very convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Compared to other prices of nearby hotels, staying at the Travelodge was a great choice. It is within walking distance to downtown Monterey and the Fisherman's Wharf. You can catch the free local bus that goes to the Monterey Bay Aquarium (called The Wave) one block from the hotel. The front desk staff is very friendly and extremely hospitable and helpful. Parking is limited. The room is nothing to write home about but is fine to drop your bags off and head to other activities. Hotel was clean. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location for a good price in this area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a very hot motorcycle ride (Hollister Rally) arrived ready to relax. Office staff was very accomodating and helpful. Assigned us the type of room requested. Very helpful in recommending local restaurants, frequented by locals, not tourists. Pillow top mattress's were wonderful! Motel is downtown, a short 6 block to the Wharf. About a mile from the Cannery area.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean but dated, circa late 50's early 60's. They have upgraded the beds, a/c-heaters. Rooms are wi-fied which was nice. Housingkeeping staff friendly. If your looking for a short stay motel (1-2) nites consider this property.
reviews.title: A Great Travelodge

likes.disliked: — It's a Travelodge -- what more could I expect?

reviews.title: Nice manager
reviews.text: I stayed at this Travelodge for a very short period, arriving late in the evening and checking out early the next morning.
